intro: Sesleria heufleriana var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved heufler’s sedge, is a perennial grass-like plant native to southern Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically broader than the standard variety, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, pale green to brownish flowers. It thrives in well-drained, sandy or gravelly soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and as a ground cover in arid landscapes.
